title: Over 100 Trump presidential gifts unaccounted for: US Democrats
description: Legislators say Trump family didn't disclose $250,000 in gifts from foreign governments received while in White House.

title: US Supreme Court honours former justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg
description: After the women's rights champion died in 2020, the US Supreme Court saw its conservative majority expand further.

title: US blasts China for attempt to ‘shield’ North Korea at UN meeting
description: The US ambassador criticises Security Council members for barring a webcast about alleged North Korean abuses.

title: What does the US hope to achieve from Blinken’s visit to Niger?
description: Antony Blinken is the first US secretary of state to visit the West African country.

title: Tunisian Interior Minister Taoufik Charfeddine resigns
description: Charfeddine, a close aide of President Kais Saied, has appeared less frequently in public in recent months.

title: All you need to know about the ICC’s arrest warrant for Putin
description: Court accuses Russian president of responsibility for war crime of illegal deportation of children from Ukraine.

title: Q&A: What the ICC arrest warrants mean for Russia’s Putin
description: Court President Piotr Hofmanski says the Russian president can be arrested if he travels to ICC member countries.

title: US announces aid as Venezuela struggles with humanitarian crisis
description: Washington does not recognise the government of Nicolas Maduro, and tensions between the two countries remain high.

title: Biden urges ‘accountability’ for executives of failed banks
description: US president calls on Congress to impose tougher penalties on senior officials of banks that fail due to mismanagement.

title: Turkey’s Erdogan says he will back Finland’s NATO bid
description: Finland and Sweden jointly applied for membership, but Ankara has so far backed only Helsinki's bid.

title: YouTube fully restores Donald Trump’s account
description: Video streaming platform says decision aims to allow voters to hear equally from candidates in the run-up to 2024 vote.

title: German minister heading to Taiwan, first such visit in 26 years
description: A government spokesperson says the visit will focus on semiconductors and not the island's sovereignty.

title: ICC issues arrest warrant for Putin on war crime allegations
description: Judges say arrest warrant issued over Russian president's alleged involvement in abductions of children from Ukraine.

title: Funeral held for footballer Christian Atsu killed in Turkey quake
description: Family, fans and beneficiaries of Christian Atsu's charitable donations remembered the 31-year-old as a philanthropist.

title: Malian PM: If Mali is a ‘sick man’, is France a failed doctor?
description: Choguel Kokalla Maiga on Mali's security crisis, defence cooperation with Russia and the pending constitutional reform.

title: Mobile court offers rare chance of justice for DRC rape victims
description: Multiple armed groups are active in eastern DR Congo, fuelling a long-running sexual violence crisis.

title: ‘Catastrophic insecurity’: 10 million children in Sahel need aid
description: UNICEF says the number of children in extreme jeopardy has doubled since 2020.

title: After drone clash, is direct Russia-US confrontation more likely?
description: This week's clash upped the ante but experts say a larger conflict is off the table.

title: Imran Khan crisis: Is Pakistan facing its own January 6 moment?
description: Unless political parties, the military and the judiciary abide by the Constitution, coming elections won't fix anything.

title: President Joe Biden to celebrate St Patrick’s Day with Irish PM
description: The cultural celebration has been observed by the Irish as a holiday for more than 1,000 years.

title: Turkey’s Cavusoglu to visit Egypt in first such trip in a decade
description: Foreign ministers Mevlut Cavusoglu and Sameh Shoukry will discuss all aspects of bilateral ties, Ankara says.

title: Champions League quarterfinals draw: Who is playing who and when?
description: The draw has been made for the quarterfinals of Europe's top club football competition.

title: UN extends Afghanistan mission by another year
description: The United Nations Security Council renews UNAMA and asks for recommendations on working with the Taliban-ruled country.

title: Wagner convict fighters recount horror, thrill of Ukraine war
description: Mercenary company is accused of using convicts freed from prison in 'human-wave attacks' during Russia's invasion.

title: Imran Khan to go to Lahore court seeking halt of arrest warrant
description: The former prime minister to march to the high court with hundreds of his supporters as tense calm prevails in the city.

title: ‘Demonising refugees’: UK plan to stop boat migration draws fire
description: Critics say proposed bill goes against international law and will end up in court if pushed through parliament.

title: Mutanabbi Street slowly re-emerges, 20 years on from Iraq war
description: The booksellers of Baghdad's Mutanabbi Street have faced invasion and bombings, two decades on from the war in Iraq.

title: Who is Humza Yousaf, SNP favourite to replace Sturgeon?
description: The 37-year-old Scot of Pakistani heritage hopes to lead the country in the wake of Sturgeon's shock resignation.

title: Iraq war: ‘The media ended up being lapdogs, not watchdogs’
description: Twenty years on from the start of the Iraq war, we look at how the US and UK media helped sell the war to the public.

title: ‘Feels like a nightmare’: Cyclone Freddy survivors weep in Malawi
description: The storm, likely the longest lasting in the southern hemisphere, has displaced hundreds of thousands of people.

title: China’s Xi Jinping to visit Russia next week, says Kremlin
description: The visit comes as China offers to broker peace in Ukraine.

title: Why Pakistan police want to arrest Imran Khan
description: In an interview with Al Jazeera, the former prime minister said at least 85 cases have been filed against him.

title: It was not Saied who introduced anti-Black racism to Tunisia
description: But the country cannot defeat this old societal ill under his divisive and hateful regime.

title: Russia may take over Toyota plant in St Petersburg: State media
description: Russian trade minister quoted as saying transfer of factory 'being considered'.

title: Sri Lanka’s economy shrank by record 7.8 percent last year
description: The contraction is the biggest in the crisis-hit island nation's 75 years of independence.

title: Australia to buy 220 Tomahawk cruise missiles from US
description: Australia will buy 220 Tomahawk cruise missiles, which can be launched from ships or submarines for attacks on land.

title: China foreign minister urges solution to Ukraine war in rare call
description: Qin Gang in phone call with counterpart Dmytro Kuleba expresses concern that war with Russia could spin out of control.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 387
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 387th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: North Korea confirms fired ICBM, says it was Hwasong-17
description: The Hwasong-17 is the largest road-mobile, liquid-fuelled ICBM in the world.

title: Q&A: Australia’s nuclear-powered submarines and ASEAN’s reaction
description: China condemned Australia's plan to acquire the attack subs from the US but how have Southeast Asian nations reacted?

title: Japan, South Korea move to mend ties at landmark summit
description: Leaders Yoon and Kishida find common ground on contentious issues amid growing regional security challenges.

title: Global bank crisis fears ease after billion-dollar lifelines
description: Asian stock markets rise after moves to shore up confidence in troubled banks in Europe and the United States.

title: Pornhub owner MindGeek bought by Canadian private equity firm
description: Sale of adult site comes after controversy over hosting of child abuse material and other non-consenual content.

title: Wagner advance in Bakhmut as Russian offensive appears to weaken
description: Russian mercenaries were the only element of Moscow's forces making any progress in the 55th week of the war in Ukraine.

title: Families urge Philippines to work with ICC on ‘drug war’ probe
description: The court is looking at the deaths of thousands of people after former President Rodrigo Duterte began his 'drugs war'.

title: ‘I can’t get rid of this trauma’: Fury over Indonesia verdicts
description: Families of those who died in October football tragedy feel the lives of their loved ones have been disrespected.
